meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a fringe or border.
meanings.sent1: The fimbrial design on the curtains added a nice touch to the room.
meanings.sent2: Her dress had a fimbrial pattern along the hem.
meanings.sent3: The fimbrial edges of the paper made it look fancy.
meanings.sent4: The fimbrial border of the painting gave it a delicate finish.
meanings.sent5: The fimbrial details on the pillow made it stand out.

meanings.definition: A structure resembling a fringe or border.
meanings.sent1: The plant had fimbrials hanging from its branches.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate fimbrial on the ancient tapestry.
meanings.sent3: The fimbrial of the costume made her look like a princess.
meanings.sent4: The fimbrial of clouds on the horizon signaled a storm approaching.
meanings.sent5: The fimbrial of feathers on the bird's wings was stunning.
